reviewText:
The Deletion is an excellent Indie platformer where you need to use your brain and patience to bypass the levels.

I will start with the pros then finishing with the cons:

Pros:
This is a very good game that can be extremely addictive due to its endless puzzles!
Crisp and smooth graphics with no lag.
Fun extensive gameplay.
Simple, smooth controls.
It's worth the buck!

Cons:
The music sounds like its from a cheap flashgame off the internet. I think that they should try and enhance the quality as it put me off at first.
Start screen is a bit chunky.
No achievements - This would be great to add as players love to try and achieve something.

All in all, The Deletion is a magnificent game. I'm just VERY picky about this selection of things, haha.
I encourage you all to buy it as it is worth the price and I'm sure there are more future updates planned ahead.

~Absent~

reviewText:
Is this a fun game? Absolutely. It's a visually basic platformer with a mixture of cliched and new mechanics. The music is quite pleasant as well.

Should you buy it? Well, you should if you're into nostalgia. Remember the days of addictinggames.com and miniclip.com where people made fun games like IndestructoTank and Defend Your Castle? And then released them free? This feels just like one of those games! With the major difference, of course, being that it isn't free. ಠ_ಠ

Luckily I picked it up with a coupon; it didn't cost more than two common trading cards.

Takes around an hour to finish; I'm going to leave it open for some time to collect the remaining cards.

reviewText: No, that's not a good game. I mean there are a lot of puzzle platformers on the market where the gameplay is based on split-second timing with a little floaty controls. If you really need another one with geometric placeholders instead of characters, then surely go for it, mind though that it can also lag from time to time.\n\nНет, это не есть хорошая игра. В смысле, на рынке представлено множество платформенных головоломок, чей игровой процесс основан на реакции в доли секунды и слегка плывущем управлении. Нет, если вам нужна еще одна с геометрическими заменителями вместо героев, тогда, конечно, вперед, только учтите, что оно еще и подтормаживает время от времени.

reviewText:
At first glance this game might not look like much but if you look past the graphics then behind it is a very unique and fun puzzle platformer.

What really makes the deletion great is it's very unique level design. Each level has it's own unique design premise. Some are just standard platforming but then others have a unique attribute to them that make them even funner. These include things like jetpacks, hidden platforms or enemies that moves when you do and many more. This means you have to attack levels in different ways and the gameplay never gets boring.

The platforming itself is solid. Very fluid jump motions that feel right. Movement feels good. Nothing really to compain about. Hit detection in terms of obstacles is right and is never off at any point.

The time to complete the game is relatively small though. It has 40 levels and it took me around 90 minutes to complete. I think this is a little to short personally and would have liked a lot more content.

The deletion has some great music to go along with it. A large selection of dance tracks definitely adds to the platform experience.

My biggest complaint is clearly the graphics. Very little effort has been put into them and there just way to simple. At first looks it looks like it should belong on a flash game site. But really this is only a minor problem because the gameplay itself is great. I do feel like the game is going to loose out on a lot of sales because of this factor.

The other small complaint I have is the lack of any kind of leaderboard. One good addition to give replayability would be a timing system. You could be timed on how quickly you complete the level. It would give people a lot of motivation to keep playing and try and beat there own record as well as there friends records. There could also be some kind of other scoring system introduced.

So overall I did really love the deletion. It has some very interesting unique platforming that I thoroughly enjoyed. I think ultimately if you can manage to look past the overly simple graphics you will find behind it a great enjoyable platformer. For the small price of £1.59 the lack of content no longer seems like a big problem either.

Maybe consider it on a sale.

A good game that should definitely be considered.

reviewText:
'the not-your-average-joe platformer with a few tricks and surprises to keep the game fresh and infuriating'

If you're a fan of short, smart, puzzling platformers then you might want to give this a try. The relatively simple art design is  easy on the eyes and it's reminiscent of classic flash games I've enjoyed in the past. The puzzles are clever and paced, ranging from difficult to relaxing with something unique on each level. However, beating this game is no easy feat. You'll be spending a lot of time repeating levels over, struggling to get it right. Toughie but a goodie.

art design = C+, level layout = B, music & sound = C-, concepts/physics = B-, overall idea & execution = solid C+½

reviewText:
Here is yet another minimalist puzzle-platformer. Steam has been absolutely flooded with them. It’s because they’re relatively simple to make. But the thing that really bares repeating – and I’m certain that I’ve already said it in summaries about other games – while a game may be simple to make the better they are the generally more time consuming they are to make. Russpuppy have nailed the brief with The Deletion. Simple to make, hard effort to perfect and a great gem of a game that I wish more people would play.

Simple everything. Graphics, sound, game design, etc. Only one thing is complex. The strategy required to defeat some of the levels. Great thing. Addictive too. Everything works entirely as it should. It makes playing the game an enjoyable and arguably addictive experience. Tight controls. It’s cheap enough that most can buy it yet it’s worth the price. Biggest in game negative is the sound. I swear my Commodore 64 had better sound. But you don’t play these games for the sound. You play them for the sense of achievement and satisfaction completing levels and the game gives you.

ARGH! Another game that should have Steam achievements that just does not have them. Frustrating. Annoying. Where is my sense of achievement that I can boast to Steam friend number 97 about how I was able to defeat X level to earn Y achievement and he cannot or at least will not. Why can I not feel as though I need to beat the game to unlock the final achievement and have finally beaten the challenge that your game has offered? This… This is the only negative. I cannot escape The Deletion until I have that sense of satisfaction.

Seriously, a great puzzle game that made my mind work in tangents as I avoid the dreaded red bars, squares and other traps to beat the game. I still want my achievements, damn you!

For more reviews similar to this one and our daily giveaways please visit http://www.steamified.com/

reviewText: This is a short, minimalist puzzle platform. The first levels are easy to solve, but it quickly becomes more challenging, relying on your timing and reflexes. The length of time it takes to complete depends on your ability to adapt to the progressively harder levels, and there is not much replay value. It also depends on your motivation to complete a game with no achievements. I recommend this game to those who want to play a short, cheap puzzle game.

reviewText:
Great retro puzzle platformer!
You are small blue square that tries to get to green end in these levels.

Your enemies are:

-Basicly all red things
- Flying red blocks
- Red walls
- Red walls coming towards you
- Red sticks that spins

In some levels you have few unique styles what you have to do or make your way for accessing green square ending

- Dragging some platforms (but you could die from them if you accidentaly drag platform to your green cube)
- Speed up cubes that will make you fly even further
- Slowing everything down zones


Pros:

- Great reduced retro visual look
- Retro style music
- Unique mechanics
- 40 levels
- Steam Cards
- Retro level menu
- Not too difficult game
- No bugs
- Works with older computers!

Cons:

- Want to make own levels
- You will suffer in some of levels (aka. Swearing)


Conclusion: Great retro puzzle platformer with low cost and fairly long levels!

reviewText: For two dollars the least they could do is use a few sprites to make it a little less boring. I'm all for indie games but if developers are too lazy to make a simple character or decent looking menu then it's worth no more than fifty cents. The puzzles seem accidental, like an embarrassing developer moment. Very boring all around without even taking the time to map out controllers. A quick buck, or two in this case. Although I hope you didn't spend that much. It's sad to see games like this on here- that took no effort and gathering praise for laziness. Buying this game only encourages them to use a circle next time and call it different"."

reviewText:
This game is very, meh to me, on one hand the level design and mechanics are very good, but on the other hand there's no replay value, theres 40 levels in all and no extra modes, and that's the problem, the entire 40 levels take 1 hour to beat (at least for me) and nothing that makes you want to come back, as it stands now, the game has potential, but is just not worth the money, the developers are clearly still updating the game (the update for mac in april) so please developers, make the game replayable, and here's how to do it (in the form of free dlc)

+some amount of extra levels
+1 gameplay mechanic
+level editor
+time trial (giving the player a reason to play the game again)

Also please ignore the fact that the first paragraph was one giant sentance.
